pullrequest.title: use CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR in pkg-config example test in case an arch-dependent lib folder is used

content.raw: It seems that `ign-cmake`'s value for `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR` includes the architecture, so it ends up being `lib/x86_64-linux-gnu`, but the example projects are getting a value of just `lib` for `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR`. In both cases, the value of that variable should be getting set by calling `include(GNUInstallDirs)`, so I'm not sure what could cause the inconsistency.
content.html: It seems that ign-cmake's value for CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR includes the architecture, so it ends up being lib/x86_64-linux-gnu, but the example projects are getting a value of just lib for CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR. In both cases, the value of that variable should be getting set by calling include(GNUInstallDirs), so I'm not sure what could cause the inconsistency.

pullrequest.title: use CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR in pkg-config example test in case an arch-dependent lib folder is used

content.raw:
Found the reason for the inconsistency:

`GNUInstallDirs` will only add the architecture postfix when [`CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` is `/usr/`](https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/blob/master/Modules/GNUInstallDirs.cmake#L231).

Since `CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` for `ign-cmake` is typically `/usr/`, the architecture will be included in `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR` for `ign-cmake`, but the example files have a `CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` which is inside the build directory, so they will not be postfixed with the architecture.
content.html:
Found the reason for the inconsistency:

GNUInstallDirs will only add the architecture postfix when CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX is /usr/.

Since CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX for ign-cmake is typically /usr/, the architecture will be included in CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR for ign-cmake, but the example files have a CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX which is inside the build directory, so they will not be postfixed with the architecture.

content.raw:
Based on this information, I think we are ok if we don't merge this pull request but keep the patch in the debian metadata. I think our CI will keep working, and the debbuilds should keep working.

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake1-release/commits/c20b79b3596e7ff75b38d92b0054941624e39be0

The only main downside is that the patch may have conflicts in the future

Any thoughts @\_jrivero_ ?

pullrequest.title: use CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR in pkg-config example test in case an arch-dependent lib folder is used

content.raw: the patch is small and I don't think that is going to be difficult to maintain. The main point is that `cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr` is a perfectly valid use case that someone can run on his/her system and we probably should fix it instead of keeping a patch for debbuilds.
content.html: the patch is small and I don't think that is going to be difficult to maintain. The main point is that cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr is a perfectly valid use case that someone can run on his/her system and we probably should fix it instead of keeping a patch for debbuilds.

pullrequest.title: use CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR in pkg-config example test in case an arch-dependent lib folder is used

content.raw:
The thing is, it's not currently broken for anyone except the debbuilds. (Edit: by "currently", I mean "on the current default, without this PR")

Is there a specific technique that is being used by the debbuilds to force the `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR` to include the architecture postfix for the example libraries? Could we disable that so the debbuilds reflect the normal user experience?
content.html:
The thing is, it's not currently broken for anyone except the debbuilds. (Edit: by "currently", I mean "on the current default, without this PR")

Is there a specific technique that is being used by the debbuilds to force the CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR to include the architecture postfix for the example libraries? Could we disable that so the debbuilds reflect the normal user experience?

pullrequest.title: use CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR in pkg-config example test in case an arch-dependent lib folder is used

content.raw:
Yep, there are some trick in debhelper. Reading [this section](https://wiki.debian.org/Multiarch/Implementation#CMake) of the multiarch manual looks like `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR`is ready in dehelper >= 10.2.1 that explains why Bionic has no problem but Xenial \(debhelper 9.x\) has.

We probably could fix the problem in a more elegant way but I think that the patch in Xenial debbuild is the fastest way. My proposal is not to invest more time and leave with the patch.
content.html:
Yep, there are some trick in debhelper. Reading this section of the multiarch manual looks like CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIRis ready in dehelper >= 10.2.1 that explains why Bionic has no problem but Xenial (debhelper 9.x) has.

We probably could fix the problem in a more elegant way but I think that the patch in Xenial debbuild is the fastest way. My proposal is not to invest more time and leave with the patch.

pullrequest.title: use CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR in pkg-config example test in case an arch-dependent lib folder is used

content.raw:
I can reproduce this failure on my local machine if I set the install prefix to `/usr`:

~~~
$ cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr
~~~
content.html:
I can reproduce this failure on my local machine if I set the install prefix to /usr:

$ cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr
